body.p: The has a user-friendly Dashboard where you can create new documents and open existing documents from your particular type of file repository integration (each type has its own unique tab and functionality). It also provides a tab with various sample documents. You can easily access the Dashboard at any time while editing documents by simply clicking the icon at the top-left corner of the screen.

section.title: Changing the Language
section.p: To change the language for the interface, click the Language icon in the top-right corner of the Dashboard and select the desired language. By default, you can choose from: English, German, French, Japanese, Dutch, or Chinese.

section.title: Help Menu
section.p:
The Dashboard page contains a Menu button in the top-right corner that contains some options to help you report issues or find more information. Clicking this button presents the following options:
About - Displays information about your version and license.

section.title: Creating a New Document
section.p:
To create a new document, follow these steps:
Go to your Dashboard page.
Click the tab for your particular file repository integration.
Depending on the type of repository, you may need to log in to your repository service. Each type of file repository service includes browsing functionality.
Example of the Browsing Functionality
Click New to create a new document.
Step Result: This opens the Create File dialog box.
Select a document template and click OK.
If applicable for your type of repository, you can change the repository, server, or branch by clicking the Edit button.
Select a destination path and name for the new document.
Click Save.
Result: The new document will be opened in a new browser tab.

section.title: Opening a Document
section.p:
To open a document, follow these steps:
Go to your Dashboard page.
Click the tab for your particular file repository integration.
Depending on the type of repository, you may need to log in to your repository service. Each type of file repository service includes a browsing pane where the repository files and folders are displayed.
If applicable for your type of repository, you can change the repository, server, or branch by clicking the Edit button.If a file is not already in your repository, you can use the Upload File button to upload it to the repository before selecting it.
Once you have found the file you want to open, double-click it (or tap on a mobile device).

Result: The selected document will be opened in a new browser tab.If you try to open a file with a format that is not supported, a page will be displayed that explains that the document could not be loaded. This page includes a Download file button that allows you to download the file so you can view or edit it in a local system application.
